values.description:
The hello world plugin tutorial had to be forked for gazebo6 (pull request #243) to set `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` in the `CMakeLists.txt`; otherwise the build will fail. Fortunately, several of the other plugin tutorials didn't have to be updated, since they were piggy-backed onto the hello world tutorial.

In order to prevent a fork, I'm updating the world_edit tutorial to piggy-back the hello world tutorial as well. The main difference is using the same folder name and appending data to the CMakeLists.txt instead of creating a new one.

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_world_properties&cat=write_plugin&branch=world_edit
values.title: Restructure world_edit tutorial to match other plugin tutorials

summary.raw:
The hello world plugin tutorial had to be forked for gazebo6 (pull request #243) to set `CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS` in the `CMakeLists.txt`; otherwise the build will fail. Fortunately, several of the other plugin tutorials didn't have to be updated, since they were piggy-backed onto the hello world tutorial.

In order to prevent a fork, I'm updating the world_edit tutorial to piggy-back the hello world tutorial as well. The main difference is using the same folder name and appending data to the CMakeLists.txt instead of creating a new one.

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_world_properties&cat=write_plugin&branch=world_edit
summary.html:
The hello world plugin tutorial had to be forked for gazebo6 (pull request #243) to set CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS in the CMakeLists.txt; otherwise the build will fail. Fortunately, several of the other plugin tutorials didn't have to be updated, since they were piggy-backed onto the hello world tutorial.

In order to prevent a fork, I'm updating the world_edit tutorial to piggy-back the hello world tutorial as well. The main difference is using the same folder name and appending data to the CMakeLists.txt instead of creating a new one.

  • http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=plugins_world_properties&cat=write_plugin&branch=world_edit

values.description:
The links to the example dem files were broken because they had been moved to a different directory in the host website. Since the files are not too large and are distributed as public domain, we can host them here and have a link to where they came from.

By the way, really cool tutorial. Unfortunately I only managed to get Rio de Janeiro to look like a stalagmite park...

![stalagmite.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RMMxjX/images/3495244422-stalagmite.png)
values.title: Digital Elevation Models: host dem files ourselves

summary.raw:
The links to the example dem files were broken because they had been moved to a different directory in the host website. Since the files are not too large and are distributed as public domain, we can host them here and have a link to where they came from.

values.description:

 * Include gazebo6
 * Remove references to Hydro and gazebo2
 * Emphasize the risk of using our non official ROS wrappers. Particularly the conflict with packages.

values.description: issue #43
values.title: Fix formatting and links in ros_comm tutorial

summary.raw: issue #43
summary.html: issue #43

values.description:
The `<tt></tt>` tags are left over from when the tutorials were hosted on mediawiki. I've replaced them with backticks. I think I fixed one case of underscore escaping as well.

There are still numerous issues with formatting in some of these tutorials. I'd prefer to address them separately.

In honor of #43:

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_comm&branch=tt_tag

I used the following command to make these changes:

~~~
sed -i -e 's@</*tt>@`@g' `grep -rlI '</*tt>' .`
~~~
values.title: Replace <tt></tt> tags with backticks ``

summary.raw:
The `<tt></tt>` tags are left over from when the tutorials were hosted on mediawiki. I've replaced them with backticks. I think I fixed one case of underscore escaping as well.

There are still numerous issues with formatting in some of these tutorials. I'd prefer to address them separately.

In honor of #43:

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_comm&branch=tt_tag

I used the following command to make these changes:

~~~
sed -i -e 's@</*tt>@`@g' `grep -rlI '</*tt>' .`
~~~
summary.html:
The <tt></tt> tags are left over from when the tutorials were hosted on mediawiki. I've replaced them with backticks. I think I fixed one case of underscore escaping as well.

There are still numerous issues with formatting in some of these tutorials. I'd prefer to address them separately.

In honor of #43:

  • http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_comm&branch=tt_tag

I used the following command to make these changes:

sed -i -e 's@</*tt>@`@g' `grep -rlI '</*tt>' .`

values.description:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=ros_urdf&cat=connect_ros&branch=ros_urdf

There's quite a bit here; sorry if it's hard to view the diff. For any lines that I touched, I tried to split them onto shorter lines. So here's a summary of the changes:

* escaping of special characters (`_` and `*`)
* adding backticks around xml tag names (`<link>`, `<collision>`, etc)
* add padding to html table using `<style>` block to improve its rendering
* minor wording changes in various places
* improve documentation of physics parameters in tables
values.title: Ros_urdf tutorial update

summary.raw:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=ros_urdf&cat=connect_ros&branch=ros_urdf

There's quite a bit here; sorry if it's hard to view the diff. For any lines that I touched, I tried to split them onto shorter lines. So here's a summary of the changes:

* escaping of special characters (`_` and `*`)
* adding backticks around xml tag names (`<link>`, `<collision>`, etc)
* add padding to html table using `<style>` block to improve its rendering
* minor wording changes in various places
* improve documentation of physics parameters in tables
summary.html:
http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=ros_urdf&cat=connect_ros&branch=ros_urdf

There's quite a bit here; sorry if it's hard to view the diff. For any lines that I touched, I tried to split them onto shorter lines. So here's a summary of the changes:

  • escaping of special characters (_ and *)
  • adding backticks around xml tag names (<link>, <collision>, etc)
  • add padding to html table using <style> block to improve its rendering
  • minor wording changes in various places
  • improve documentation of physics parameters in tables

values.description:
Update ros_control tutorial to mention that `<hardwareInterface>` tag must be child of both joint and actuator.

* http://gazebosim.org/tutorials/?tut=ros_control&branch=ros_control_hardware_interface

See also:

* https://github.com/ros-controls/ros_control/issues/177
* https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_demos/pull/4
* https://bitbucket.org/nasa_ros_pkg/nasa_r2_simulator/pull-requests/12
values.title: ros_control tutorial: mention that `<hardwareInterface>` tag must be child of both joint and actuator
